term.name: formalism
term.source: From English form: the shape of a thing or the arrangement of its parts.
term.def: A theory that emphasizes adherence to formal rules, usually in preference to the benefits or consequences of human action; an example is &deontologism;.
A theory that emphasizes the importance of artistic form, often in preference to artistic content; examples include some varieties of &classicism; and &modernism;.
